page.title: 05SHOE INDUSTRY IN WARMINSTER
page.content: Avalon Industries is a subsidiary of Clarks Shoe Company which is based in Somerset. The Avalon works in Warminster employs 201 people making plastic and steel shoe components such as heel reinforcements. Works manager Mr Basil Haines estimates 1985 production as 100 million component parts. Products are delivered 4 times a week as far away as Kendal, London, Norfolk and Penzance. Works engineers carry out all tooling and maintenance for the injection moulding machines and power presses worth Â£1m. Part of the factory is in arched "Romney Huts" built in the 1939-45 War to store sugar for the Ministry of Food. Bought and converted by Clarks after the War, the huts eventually couldn't cope with increased production so more modern buildings were added in 1960.
